Column Comment.0: MAPPING IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a mapping between systems.
Column Comment.1: LOAD PROCESS IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a loading process in a datamodel.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: DELETE ALLOWED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data isallowed to be deleted (Y) or not allowed to be deleted (N).
Column Comment.4: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.5: END DATE: the date that this load was completed.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.7: INSERT ALLOWED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether a row of data isallowed to be inserted (Y) or not allowed to be inserted (N).
Column Comment.8: PPDM GROUP IDENTIFIER: Unique ID for used to track associations betweenmapping load processes.
Column Comment.9: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.10: PROCEDURE IDENTIFIER: Identifier for procedures used for a load process. Maybe a stored procedure, called procedure, function etc.
Column Comment.11: PROCEDURE NAME: The name of the procedure, it is referenced byPROCEDURE_ID.
Column Comment.12: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.13: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.14: SOURCE SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: the unique identifier for the coordinate system thatis the source for the data in the load.
Column Comment.15: START DATE: the date that this load was started.
Column Comment.16: SOFTWARE APPLICATION IDENTIFIER: The identifier for the application that ownsthis alias or code or that is used to apply the data in this row.
Column Comment.17: TARGET SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: the unique identifier for the coordinate system thatis the target for the data in the load.
Column Comment.18: UPDATE ALLOWED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether a row of data isallowed to be updated (Y) or not allowed to be updated (N).
Column Comment.19: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.21: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.23: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: PPDM ROW QUALILTY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
